title: Two Studies Make the Case For Eating a Lot More Plants for Your Health and the Planet - VegNews
summary: Two studies highlight the positive impacts of plant-based diets on both human health and the environment. Replacing half of meat with plant-based alternatives could significantly reduce agricultural pollution by 2050, while substituting processed meat with plant-based options like nuts or legumes is linked to lower risks of heart disease and type 2 diabetes.

title: Bio-Link Introduces New Water Purification System, Revolutionizing Global Water Quality APAC - English - APAC - PR Newswire
summary: Hong Kong-based Bio-Link, in partnership with American Bio-Pro, has launched a cutting-edge reverse osmosis (RO) water purification system. This new system combines ultrafiltration and RO technology to remove impurities, bacteria, and viruses, ensuring water purity. The system is designed to meet high global demands for clean water and is particularly focused on Asian markets.

title: Move Over, Los Angeles and NYC: These 3 City Council Votes Could Make Pittsburgh the New Vegan Capital - VegNews
summary: Pittsburgh City Council is considering a series of animal rights bills that would ban the sale and manufacturing of fur products, the use of horse-drawn carriages, and the sale of foie gras. These bills aim to improve animal welfare in the city, and if passed, Pittsburgh would join other cities like New York City and Los Angeles in implementing such measures. The bills are driven by the desire to protect animals from suffering and promote humane treatment practices.

title: Oji Holdings' Paper Production Wields SDGs Ideals to Forge New Paths | NIKKEI ESG Management Forum - 日経BP
summary: Oji Holdings, Japan's leading paper firm, is embracing sustainability by utilizing forest resources for innovative products and processes.  They are moving away from traditional printing paper to focus on green innovations like biomass plastic, bio-ethanol for sustainable aviation fuel, and pharmaceuticals derived from hemicellulose.  This shift is driven by declining demand for printing paper and a commitment to mitigating climate change.

title: Councilor push ‘waste consciousness culture’ - Mindanao Times
summary: Councilor Tek Ocampo, chair of the Davao City environment committee, emphasizes the need to develop a culture of waste consciousness to address the city's solid waste management challenges. He advocates for implementing a circular economy policy modeled after Japan's successful approach, which includes waste segregation, recycling, and resource recovery.  The councilor plans to utilize a 60 million Euro grant to implement green economy programs and educate residents through workshops and a Barangay Solid Waste Management Summit.

title: Capital market investment up by 8pc - Daily News
summary: Tanzania's capital market value has grown by 7.6% in a year, reaching 36.13tri/-. The growth is attributed to favorable investment policies and the introduction of new products like green bonds, social bonds, and Sukuk bonds. These innovations have positioned Tanzania as a leader in capital markets, attracting both local and foreign investment.
